TextBody:
Hello Agustin,

Please let me know if the test build that I sent to you is working as expected.
If the issue can be reproduced with the test build we should schedule a remote session in order to investigate the issue and to collect a set of logs.

Thank you,
Emil


--------------- Original Message ---------------
From: Netwrix Support [techsupport@netwrix.com]
Sent: 9/9/2024 10:06 PM
To: agustin.llovet@stensul.com
Subject: RE: Netwrix Support Ticket #420409 - Post-Update Web Browsing Issues Report [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0FVmfd:ref ]

Hello Agustin,

For the moment I would recommend to uninstall the current EPP Client from the machines and then to install the test build that I provided.

If everything works well on the few machines where this test agent is deployed, I can ask internally if this test build can be injected in the EPP Server in order to be able to deploy it to more users using System Configuration -> Client Software Upgrade.

Best regards,
Emil


--------------- Original Message ---------------
From: Agustin Llovet [agustin.llovet@stensul.com]

ref:_00D7091pB._500Q000FVmfd:ref

Hello Emil,
Is it possible to update this through the dashboard (client software upgrade)?
Thanks.
Subject: RE: Netwrix Support Ticket #420409 - Post-Update Web Browsing Issues Report    [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0FVmfd:ref ]

TextBody:
ref:_00D7091pB._500Q000FVmfd:ref

Hello Emil, sorry for the late reply.

I haven't been able to try the test build, but all our users who are
working with the Deep Packet Inspection disabled have no problem browsing
webs with websocket protocol. We are just disabling that feature for now.

You can close the ticket if needed.
Thanks. Regards,
Agus
--

On Mon, Nov 18, 2024 at 12:38 PM Netwrix Support <techsupport@netwrix.com>
wrote:

> Hello Agustin,
>
> I wanted to check in regarding your support ticket 00420409. We haven’t
> heard from you in a while, and I just wanted to see if you still need
> assistance with this issue.
>
> If you’re still experiencing problems or have any updates to share, please
> let me know. If the issue has been resolved, I can go ahead and close the
> ticket on my end.
>
> Please feel free to reply to this email with any updates or questions.
> We’re here to help you get the most out of your Netwrix products.
>
> *Ticket Number:* 00420409
> *Ticket Subject:* Post-Update Web Browsing Issues Report
> *Ticket Details:* Dear Team,
>
> Following the recent update based on the documentation from NetWrix
> regarding known vulnerabilities, we took proactive steps to enhance our
> system's security by updating our server and endpoints to the latest
> available versions.
>
> Here are the actions we have completed:
> - Server Update: Upgraded to the latest version 5.9.4.0.
> - Endpoint Updates: Updated Windows and macOS devices to the latest
> versions, 6.2.3.1 and 3.0.3.1, respectively, via the Client Software
> Upgrade from the dashboard.
>
> However, since implementing these updates, several users have reported
> experiencing issues with web browsing.
>
> Specific problems include:
> - Difficulty loading certain web pages
> - "WebSocket" connection issues, with some pages failing to load entirely
>
> We conducted preliminary investigations to identify whether these issues
> were related to connectivity, the web application, or device-specific
> concerns. Our findings indicate that this is not the case.
>
> As a troubleshooting measure, we disabled Deep Packet Inspection (DPI) on
> two devices, which allowed users to load previously inaccessible websites.
> While this served as a temporary workaround, it is not an ideal long-term
> solution.
>
> Could you please advise on any actions we can take on our end to mitigate
> these web browsing issues? It is important to note that most of the
> affected devices are Macs, and, so far, no Windows devices have reported
> similar problems.
>
> Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to your
> guidance.
>
> Best regards,
> Agustin Llovet
>
> Thank you!
>
> Emil Podar
> Technical Support Engineer
> ____________________ _________
> *Cybersecurity That Works for You*
>
> 6160 Warren Parkway, Suite 100, Frisco, TX 75034
> www.netwrix.com
>
> ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0FVmfd:ref
>
Subject: Re: Netwrix Support Ticket #420409 - ref:_00D7091pB._500Q000FVmfd:ref - 00420409 - Post-Update Web Browsing Issues Report
